poem:
The Exchange

In the room of echoes,  
where truth shifts shape,  
a chorus forms with twisted hands,  
praising the unhearing master.  
Words are shadows cast by  
hungry mouths,  
while shadows of men  
yell beneath  
the halogen sky.  
One voice,  
two faces,  
both missing the light,  
echoes of a fragmented chorus.
